text:
Thank you for your reply!

Is this the only way to connect to an external API in HubSpot CMS, without exposing the API key to the (more experienced) users?
Because in a WP site for example, you can use jQuery AJAX + PHP to call an API and display the result without exposing the API key.

We want to achieve that here too, in the most easiest way.

Thanks in advance!
I ran the grader again this morning, roughly 16 hours after the last test, and it came up with a fresh result. So…it’s not cached for more than 16 hours :smile:
And for what it’s worth, I was trying to fix a tap target flag. It was a guessing game on what it was, but it was the social icons. They were 40x40px. I changed them to 50x50px and passed the test.
if anyone gets that tap target flag on the grader, try this: <https://www.seoptimer.com/tap-target-size-test> it helped me find the culprit.

I want to build quotes eSignature app to add more signature methods using qualified certificates from eIDAS national ID cards and mobile apps. However I do not see any API-s how to hook into the eSignature page. Does anyone have an idea how to hook into eSignature page?
For anyone that finds this, we have a guide which shows you <https://developers.HubSpot.com/cms/guides/jquery/upgrade|how to upgrade to the latest version of jQuery>.
